page.title: 02Farming In Dentdale.
page.content: There are milk farmers and suckler farmers in Dentdale.Some farms have camping and caravans,like Conder Farm and High Laning,they both sell fresh milk,yoghurt,eggs and cream.There are a lot of old farms in Dentdale that are empty now,these are sometimes renovated to make holiday cottages, others are left in ruins and the land farmed by other local farmers.Farmers allow holiday makers to watch them do their work,some visitors even volunteer to help, especially during haytime. Sometimes barn rallies are held,at Mill Beck Farm in 1985 some 200 people attended.Most farmers in the area try to keep the traditional style of farming,visiting Hawes or Sedbergh for the Auction Markets,and doing all they can to protect wild flowers, birds and creatures great and small.
